string-array.name: facts
string-array.item: The production of meat and dairy products is a major contributor to greenhouse gas emissions and climate change, particularly due to the methane produced by cows and other ruminant animals.
Industrial agriculture practices such as the use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides can contribute to soil degradation, water pollution, and the loss of biodiversity.
The overfishing and destruction of marine habitats can lead to the depletion of fish populations and harm ocean ecosystems.
The production of crops such as corn and soybeans for use as animal feed can contribute to monoculture farming and the loss of soil health and fertility.
Eating a quarter-pound hamburger is equivalent to showering for 3 hours in terms of water usage.
Producing a pound of beef requires 20 times more land and emits 20 times more greenhouse gases than producing a pound of beans.
One pound of cheese requires about 10 pounds of milk, and dairy cows consume up to 100 pounds of feed per day.
Eating a 4-ounce serving of salmon is equivalent to leaving a 60-watt light bulb on for 4 hours in terms of greenhouse gas emissions.
A single avocado requires 60 gallons of water to produce, which is equivalent to showering for 6 minutes.
Producing a single pound of almonds requires over 1,900 gallons of water, which is equivalent to showering for 4 hours.
The average American wastes about 30% of the food they buy, which is equivalent to throwing away 165 billion dollars worth of food each year.
Eating a pound of chicken is equivalent to driving about 9.2 miles in terms of greenhouse gas emissions.
The production of a single pound of pork requires 2.5 times more water and generates 3.5 times more greenhouse gases than producing a pound of chicken.
Eating a 4-ounce serving of shrimp is equivalent to driving a car for over a mile in terms of greenhouse gas emissions.
Producing a pound of chocolate requires 3,170 gallons of water, which is equivalent to showering for over 2 weeks.
The average American consumes over 130 pounds of meat per year, which is more than double the global average.
Producing a pound of coffee requires about 2,000 gallons of water, which is equivalent to showering for 6 weeks.
The production of a single egg requires about 53 gallons of water, which is equivalent to leaving a faucet running for 2 hours.
Producing a pound of tomatoes requires about 23 gallons of water, which is equivalent to taking a 10-minute shower.
The production of a single gallon of milk requires about 1,000 gallons of water, and dairy farming is a major source of greenhouse gas emissions.
Eating a pound of lamb is equivalent to driving a car for about 25 miles in terms of greenhouse gas emissions.
Producing a pound of rice requires about 450 gallons of water, which is equivalent to showering for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Eating a 4-ounce serving of tofu is equivalent to charging a smartphone for 100 hours in terms of greenhouse gas emissions.
Producing a pound of lettuce requires about 15 gallons of water, which is equivalent to flushing a toilet 5 times.
